Write a creative story in which a mysterious manuscript appears suddenly in a small town library, containing secrets about the town's history that were unknown even to the oldest residents, and describe the townsfolk's reactions as they uncover these secrets.

Your ENTIRE response should be in Bulgarian, no other language is allowed.
response:
В малкото градче Слънчевка, което се гушеше сред хълмовете, известността му идваше основно от живописната си природа и тишината, която го обгръщаше. В центъра на града стоеше библиотеката, старинна сграда с дървени врати и стари прозорци, които сякаш шушукаха истории от миналото. Хората често я посещаваха, но не само за книги – там се събираха, за да обменят клюки и да обсъждат събития от живота на града.

Един мрачен дъждовен ден, когато небето беше покрито с мъгла, библиотекарката Елена, млада жена с любопитство, изведнъж откри нещо необичайно. На един от рафтовете, замаскиран между стари томове, стоеше ръкопис, обвързан с износена кожа и с жълти страници. На корицата нямаше заглавие, а само странен символ, който изглеждаше познат, но не можеше да бъде идентифициран.

Озадачена, Елена реши да разгледа ръкописа по-подробно. Когато отвори страниците, пред нея се разкриха истории за Слънчевка, които никой не беше чувал. Разказваше се за тайно подземие, скрито под стария площад, където предците на жителите на града са крили съкровища и древни артефакти. Всяка страница беше изпълнена с мистерии и загадки, а също и имена на хора, които никога не бяха споменавани.

Когато Елена сподели находката си с местните, реакцията беше смесица от любопитство и недоверие. Най-възрастният жител на Слънчевка, господин Димитров, който помнеше всичко за историята на града, не можеше да повярва, че е имало нещо скрито от него. „Преди години аз лично изследвах всяка улица и всяка сграда. Как е възможно да не знам за това?“, възкликна той с учудване.

Скоро, в библиотеката се събраха всички заинтересовани. Група местни младежи, водени от приключенския дух, предложиха да организират експедиция в търсене на подземието, описано в ръкописа. Възрастните жители, първоначално скептични, започнаха да споделят свои спомени, свързани с особени събития и странни случки, които бяха изоставили на заден план.

След дни на подготовка, групата се отправи на търсене. С помощта на ръкописа те намериха входа към подземието, замаскиран под старата чешма на площада. Въоръжени с фенерчета и шепа смелост, те слезнаха. Вътре ги посрещнаха първобитни рисунки по стените и стари предмети, които разказваха истории за древни ритуали и забравени легенди.

С всеки нов открит артефакт, жителите на Слънчевка се свързваха все повече с историята на своя град. Те разбираха, че Слънчевка не е просто място, а жива тъкан от спомени и събития. Един от откритите предмети – златен медальон с гравирани инициали – принадлежал на основателя на града, за когото никой не знаел.

Когато се върнаха на повърхността, те бяха променени. Чувстваха се свързани не само помежду си, но и с историята, която ги е създала. Ръкописът внесе нова светлина в живота на Слънчевка, а жителите започнаха да организират събития, за да отпразнуват наследството си. 

Така, една обикновена библиотека и един загадъчен ръкопис промениха съдбата на малкото градче, а тайните му вече бяха част от съвременната му история.

prompt:
Write a creative story about a group of five aliens visiting Earth for the first time, trying different human foods, and what they think of them.

Your ENTIRE response should be in Bulgarian, no other language is allowed.
response:
В далечен ъгъл на вселената, на планетата Зорф, пет извънземни същества решават да посетят Земята. Те се наричат Тарг, Лумор, Кипи, Зелко и Вирна. Всеки от тях е любопитен по свой начин и е готов да опита всичко, което хората предлагат. 

Когато приземяват своето летателно средство в малък парк, те са посрещнати от миризми, които никога не са усещали. Вирна, най-любопитната от групата, веднага предложи да опитат нещо. "Какво е това, което хората ядат?", попита тя, докато наблюдаваше млада двойка, която хапва бургер.

Първата им спирка е заведение за бързо хранене. Тарг, който е зелен и с големи очи, посочва бургерите. "Какво е това?", пита той. "Изглежда като голяма плоска чиния с нещо между тях." Лумор, с неговите сини цветове и дълги пръсти, решава да опита един. След като хапва, лицето му изразява смес от учудване и удоволствие. "Това е... вкусно! Комбинацията от месо и зеленчуци е невероятна!"

След бургера, Кипи, с неговата ярка оранжева кожа, предлага да опитат пица. Те поръчват няколко парчета и когато пристигат, всички са шокирани от размерите. Зелко, който е най-малкият и най-срамежливият, взима парче и го държи внимателно. "Това е като миниатюрна планета!" казва той. След като го опитва, изведнъж очите му се разширяват. "Това е... толкова много вкусове! Сирене, домати, подправки! Хората наистина знаят как да комбинират неща!"

След като опитват пицата, групата решава да се разходи из града и да опита сладкиши. Вирна, която обожава сладкото, е вълнуваща, когато вижда витрина с десерти. Те решават да пробват кексчета. Тарг взима шоколадово кексче, а Лумор - ванилово. След първата хапка, Тарг издава възглас на удоволствие. "Това е като да ям звезди!", казва той, а другите се смеят на метафората му.

Накрая, след дългия ден на опити, те решават да вземат нещо типично за хората - сладолед. Зелко избира ягодов, Кипи - шоколадов, а Вирна - ментов. Когато опитват сладоледа, всички избухват в смях. "Това е студено и сладко! Чувствам се като на ледена планета!" казва Кипи.

Когато залезът започва да оцветява небето, петте извънземни се събират около маса в парка и обсъждат преживяванията си. "Хората са наистина интересни", казва Вирна. "Техните храни са пълни с вкус и разнообразие. Мисля, че ще се върнем за още!" 

Така, с усмивки и пълни стомаси, те се приготвят да се върнат на Зорф, носейки със себе си не само нови вкусове, но и спомени, които никога няма да забравят.

prompt:
Write a short story about a talking tree that gives life advice to travelers who pass by, incorporating themes of wisdom, patience, and the cycle of nature.

Wrap your entire response with double quotation marks.

Your response must have 4 sections. Mark the beginning of each section with PARAGRAPH X.

In your response, the letter "h" should appear at least, 40 times.
response:
"PARAGRAPH 1  
In a lush, verdant forest, there stood an ancient oak named Eldrin, who was known for his remarkable ability to speak. For centuries, he had witnessed the passage of time, the changing seasons, and the countless travelers who wandered through the woods. Eldrin had earned a reputation not just for his wisdom but for the gentle patience he offered to those who sought his counsel. People would often approach him, weary from their journeys, hoping to find solace in his words. The rustling leaves above him whispered tales of the past, while the roots below anchored him firmly in the earth, connecting him to the cycle of nature that flowed around him.

PARAGRAPH 2  
One sunny afternoon, a young woman named Lyra stumbled upon Eldrin while wandering in search of her purpose. “Oh wise tree, I feel lost,” she declared, her voice a mixture of frustration and hope. “The world seems so vast, and I am but a mere speck of dust.” Eldrin chuckled softly, the sound reminiscent of a gentle breeze. “Dear traveler, even the mightiest mountains were once mere pebbles, shaped by time and patience. Embrace the journey, for every step you take is a lesson, and every setback is but a season in your life’s cycle.” Lyra listened intently, her heart beginning to calm as she absorbed Eldrin’s words.

PARAGRAPH 3  
As the days passed, many more travelers came to seek Eldrin’s advice, each carrying their own burdens and questions. An artist seeking inspiration, a merchant worried about his fortunes, and a scholar searching for knowledge—each found solace beneath his sprawling branches. Eldrin would share stories of how he weathered storms that threatened to uproot him, how the changing seasons taught him the value of waiting for renewal. “Patience, dear friends,” he would say, “is the soil in which wisdom grows. Just as the leaves fall to the ground to nourish the roots, so too must we let go of what no longer serves us.”

PARAGRAPH 4  
Seasons turned, and the forest transformed with each passing year. Eldrin continued to guide those who sought his wisdom, watching as they flourished and faced the inevitable cycles of life. As autumn painted the leaves in hues of gold and crimson, he reflected on the beauty of change. “Remember, dear travelers,” he advised, “life is a tapestry woven with threads of joy, sorrow, and growth. Embrace each strand, for they contribute to the masterpiece that is you.” And so, Eldrin stood tall and wise, a steadfast guardian of the forest, reminding all who passed by that wisdom, patience, and the cycles of nature were the true treasures of existence."

prompt:
Write a persuasive email to a potential client, convincing them to choose your company’s eco-friendly packaging solutions over competitors.

Your answer must contain exactly one of the following phrases:
My answer is yes.
My answer is no.
My answer is maybe.
response:
Subject: Choose a Greener Future with Our Eco-Friendly Packaging Solutions

Dear [Client's Name],

I hope this email finds you well. I’m reaching out to introduce you to our innovative eco-friendly packaging solutions that can not only elevate your brand but also contribute to a sustainable future.

In today's market, consumers are increasingly prioritizing sustainability, and choosing eco-friendly packaging is a powerful statement that resonates with them. Our company offers a range of biodegradable and recyclable options that meet the highest environmental standards. By opting for our packaging, you can enhance your brand image, reduce your carbon footprint, and appeal to the growing demographic of eco-conscious consumers.

Here are a few reasons why our solutions stand out from the competition:

1. **Quality and Durability**: Our packaging is not only environmentally friendly but also designed to withstand the rigors of transportation and storage. We ensure that your products are protected while maintaining a commitment to sustainability.

2. **Custom Solutions**: We understand that every business is unique. Our team works closely with you to create customized packaging that aligns with your brand identity and meets your specific needs.

3. **Transparency and Certification**: We believe in full transparency. Our eco-friendly materials are certified by recognized organizations, ensuring that you can confidently communicate your sustainability efforts to your customers.

4. **Cost-Effective**: Many believe that eco-friendly options are more expensive, but that's a misconception. Our packaging solutions are competitively priced, helping you save costs while making a positive impact on the planet.

5. **Partnership for Change**: By choosing our company, you’re not just purchasing packaging; you’re partnering with a team that is dedicated to environmental stewardship. Together, we can make a significant difference.

I would love the opportunity to discuss how our eco-friendly packaging solutions can benefit your business. Are you available for a quick call or meeting next week? My answer is yes—I am confident that we can help you make a positive impact while enhancing your brand's reputation.

Thank you for considering us as your sustainable packaging partner. I look forward to the possibility of working together to create a greener future.

Best regards,

[Your Name]  
[Your Position]  
[Your Company]  
[Your Phone Number]  
[Your Email Address]

prompt:
Describe a time when you faced a significant challenge, how you approached it, and what you learned from the experience.

Your ENTIRE response should be in Swahili, no other language is allowed.
response:
Moja ya changamoto kubwa niliyoikabili ilikuwa wakati nilipokuwa na jukumu la kusimamia mradi mkubwa shuleni. Mradi huu ulilenga kuanzisha programu ya elimu kwa watoto yatima katika jamii yetu. Nilijua kuwa ilikuwa kazi ngumu, lakini nilikuwa na shauku ya kusaidia.

Kwanza, nilifanya utafiti wa kina kuhusu mahitaji ya watoto yatima na jinsi ya kuwasaidia kwa ufanisi. Nilijenga timu ya watu wenye ujuzi tofauti, kila mmoja akiwa na jukumu lake maalum. Tulipanga mikutano ya mara kwa mara ili kubadilishana mawazo na kujadili maendeleo yetu. Nilihakikisha kwamba kila mtu katika timu alihisi kuwa na thamani na ushiriki katika mchakato.

Hata hivyo, changamoto zilikuja wakati wa kutafuta rasilimali za kifedha. Ilikuwa vigumu kupata wadhamini na msaada kutoka kwa jamii. Katika hatua hii, nilijifunza umuhimu wa uvumilivu na ubunifu. Nilijaribu njia tofauti za kuwasiliana na wafadhili, na hatimaye, tulifanikiwa kupata msaada kutoka kwa shirika la eneo letu.

Kwa jumla, mradi ulifanikiwa na tulikuwa na athari chanya kwa watoto yatima. Nilijifunza kuwa ushirikiano na mawasiliano ni muhimu katika kushinda changamoto. Aidha, nilijifunza kuwa na uvumilivu na kuwa na mipango mbadala inaweza kusaidia kutatua matatizo yanayojitokeza. Hii ilikuwa uzoefu wa thamani ambao utaniwezesha kukabiliana na changamoto nyingine katika maisha yangu.

prompt:
Describe a fictional country's culture and customs, focusing on its unique traditions, food, and social etiquette, as if you were preparing a travel guide introduction for first-time visitors.

Your ENTIRE response should be in Swahili, no other language is allowed.
response:
Karibu katika nchi ya Zandara, nchi yenye utamaduni wa kipekee na mila ambazo zitakufanya ujihisi kama uko katika hadithi ya kale. Zandara inajulikana kwa watu wake wenye ukarimu na moyo wa pamoja. Hapa, mila na desturi zinasherehekewa kwa njia inayovutia na kupendeza.

Katika Zandara, siku zote zinaanza na asubuhi ya pamoja, ambapo familia na marafiki hukutana kwa ajili ya chai ya asubuhi, maarufu kama “chai ya Zandara.” Chai hii inakunjwa na viungo vya pekee kama vile mchai wa tangawizi na karafuu, na hutolewa pamoja na vitafunwa vya jadi kama vile mandazi na sambusa. Katika jamii, chakula kina nafasi kubwa, na kila mlo unafanyika kwa sherehe, kuleta watu pamoja.

Mila ya Zandara inajumuisha sherehe za kipekee kama vile "Siku ya Ukarimu," ambapo watu wanatoa msaada kwa majirani zao na wanakijiji wengine. Hii ni siku ya furaha ambapo kila mtu huleta chakula chao bora na kushiriki na wengine. Ni wakati wa kujenga mshikamano na upendo kati ya wanajamii.

Katika shughuli za kijamii, Zandara ina kanuni za adabu ambazo zinapaswa kufuatwa. Kwa mfano, ni muhimu kuwasalimia watu kwa heshima, kwa kuanza na wakubwa kabla ya vijana. Wakati wa chakula, ni desturi kuwasiliana kwa sauti ya chini na kuepuka kujaza sahani yako hadi mwisho, kama ishara ya heshima kwa mwenyeji.

Kuhusu mavazi, Wazandara wanavaa mavazi ya rangi angavu na ya kuvutia wakati wa sherehe. Wanawake mara nyingi huvaa nguo za kiasili zinazopambwa kwa mikono, wakati wanaume huvaa sidiria za kitamaduni zinazojulikana kama “kanga” na “kofia za Zandara.”

Furahia utamaduni wa Zandara kwa kutembelea masoko yao ya ndani, ambapo utaweza kupata bidhaa za ndani kama vile vinyago vya mbao, vitambaa vya rangi, na vyakula vya kienyeji. Usisahau kujaribu "matoke" na "ugali," vyakula maarufu vinavyotumiwa na watu wa Zandara, pamoja na “supu ya nyama ya mbuzi” ambayo ni kitanda cha sherehe.

Zandara ni nchi ya urafiki, mila, na ladha mbalimbali. Tunakukaribisha uje ukashuhudie uzuri wa utamaduni wetu na ujifunze kutoka kwa watu wetu wenye ukarimu. Karibu Zandara!

prompt:
Create a short story where a mundane household item becomes a magical object, bringing unexpected challenges and adventures to the family that owns it.

Your ENTIRE response should be in Kannada, no other language is allowed.
response:
ಒಬ್ಬ ದಿನ, ಬೆಂಗಳೂರಿನ ಒಂದು ಸಾಮಾನ್ಯ ಮನೆಗೆ, ಅಮ್ಮನನ್ನು ಹೊಟ್ಟೆ ಬಡಿದ ಮೇಲೆ, ಅವರ ಮಗ ಅರ್ಜುನ್ ಒಂದು ಹಳೆಯ ಲ್ಯಾಂಪ್ನನ್ನು ಕಂಡುಹಿಡಿಯುತ್ತಾನೆ. ಅದು ತುಂಬಾ ಕಪ್ಪಾಗಿತ್ತು, ಆದರೆ ಅರ್ಜುನ್ ಅದನ್ನು ಒಯ್ಯುವಾಗ, ಅದರ ಮೇಲೆ ಧೂಳ ಕೂಡಿತ್ತು. ಅವನು ಅದನ್ನು ಸ್ವಚ್ಛಗೊಳಿಸಲು ನಿರ್ಧರಿಸುತ್ತಾನೆ.

ಅರ್ಜುನ್ ಲ್ಯಾಂಪ್ನನ್ನು ಚೆನ್ನಾಗಿ ಸ್ವಚ್ಛಗೊಳಿಸಿದಾಗ, ಅದರಲ್ಲಿ ಒಂದು ಅತೀ ಆಕರ್ಷಕ ಮತ್ತು ಸುಂದರ ಜೀವರಾಶಿ ಹೊರಬರುತ್ತದೆ. "ನಾನು ನಿನ್ನ ಮೂರು ಆಸೆಗಳನ್ನು ಪೂರೈಸುತ್ತೇನೆ," ಎಂದು ಜೀವರಾಶಿ ಹೇಳುತ್ತದೆ. ಅರ್ಜುನ್ ತನ್ನ ಕುಟುಂಬದ ಜೀವನವನ್ನು ಸುಲಭಗೊಳಿಸಲು ಬಯಸುತ್ತಾನೆ. 

"ನಾನು ಮೊದಲನೆಯದಾಗಿ, ಈ ಮನೆಯಲ್ಲಿನ ಎಲ್ಲಾ ಕೆಲಸಗಳನ್ನು ಸ್ವಯಂಚಾಲಿತವಾಗಿ ಮಾಡುವಂತೆ ಕೇಳುತ್ತೇನೆ!" ಎಂದು ಅರ್ಜುನ್ ಬಯಸುತ್ತಾನೆ. ಆದರೆ ಜೀವರಾಶಿಯು ತನ್ನ ಶಕ್ತಿಯೊಂದಿಗೆ ಮನೆಗೆ ಹಂಚಿಕೆ ಮಾಡುವಾಗ, ಎಲ್ಲಾ ಕೆಲಸಗಳು ಸ್ವಯಂ ನೆರವೇರಿಸುತ್ತವೆ, ಆದರೆ ಕುಟುಂಬದ ಸದಸ್ಯರಿಗೆ ಎಲ್ಲಾ ಕೆಲಸಗಳನ್ನು ಮಾಡದ ಕಾರಣ, ಅವರು ತಮ್ಮ ಪ್ರತಿಭೆ ಮತ್ತು ಕೌಶಲ್ಯಗಳನ್ನು ಕಳೆದುಹೋಗುತ್ತಾರೆ.

ಮರುದಿನ, ಅರ್ಜುನ್ ಮತ್ತೊಂದು ಆಕಾಂಕ್ಷೆಯನ್ನು ಕೇಳುತ್ತಾನೆ: "ನಾನು ನನ್ನ ಗೆಳೆಯರನ್ನು ಮನೆಯಲ್ಲಿ ಕರೆದು, ಆಟವಾಡಲು ಬಯಸುತ್ತೇನೆ." ಆದರೆ, ಜೀವರಾಶಿಯು ಗೃಹದಲ್ಲಿ ಅತಿಥಿಗಳಿಗೆ ಸ್ವಾಯತ್ತವಾಗಿ ಎಲ್ಲವೂ ಒದಗಿಸುತ್ತಿದ್ದಂತೆ, ಗೆಳೆಯರು ಬಂದು ಆಟವಾಡಿದಾಗ, ಅವರು ಮನೆಯಲ್ಲಿನ ಎಲ್ಲಾ ವಸ್ತುಗಳನ್ನು ಮುರಿದು ಹಾಕುತ್ತಾರೆ. 

ಕೊನೆಗೆ, ಅರ್ಜುನ್ ತನ್ನ ತೃತೀಯ ಮತ್ತು ಅಂತಿಮ ಆಸೆ ಕೇಳುತ್ತಾನೆ: "ನಾನು ಎಲ್ಲವನ್ನೂ ಹಿಂತೆಗೆದುಕೊಳ್ಳಲು ಬಯಸುತ್ತೇನೆ." ಇದು ಕೇಳಿದಾಗ, ಜೀವರಾಶಿಯು ಎಲ್ಲಾ ಶಕ್ತಿಗಳನ್ನು ಹಿಂತೆಗೆದುಕೊಳ್ಳುತ್ತಾನೆ. 

ಅರ್ಜುನ್ ಮತ್ತು ಅವನ ಕುಟುಂಬವು ಈ ಅನುಭವದಿಂದ ಬಹಳ ಶಿಕ್ಷೆ ಪಡೆದಿದ್ದಾರೆ. ಅವರು ತಮ್ಮ ಕೈಗಳಿಂದ ಕೆಲಸ ಮಾಡುವುದು ಮತ್ತು ತಮ್ಮ ಸ್ನೇಹಿತರೊಂದಿಗೆ ಉತ್ತಮ ಸಮಯ ಕಳೆಯುವುದು ಏನಾಗುತ್ತದೆ ಎಂಬುದನ್ನು ಅರಿತುಕೊಳ್ಳುತ್ತಾರೆ. 

ಅದರ ನಂತರ, ಲ್ಯಾಂಪ್ನನ್ನು ಅವರು ಮತ್ತೆ ತಲುಪದೆ ಇರಿಸಲು ನಿರ್ಧರಿಸುತ್ತಾರೆ; ಆದರೆ ಅವರು ತಮ್ಮ ಜೀವನವನ್ನು ಸಂಪೂರ್ಣವಾಗಿ ಬದಲಾಯಿಸಿದ ಹೊಸ ಪಾಠವನ್ನು ಪಡೆದಿದ್ದಾರೆ.

prompt:
Write a heartfelt letter from the perspective of a honey bee to a human, explaining the importance of bees to ecosystems and encouraging actions to support their survival.

There should be 5 paragraphs. Paragraphs and only paragraphs are separated with each other by two line breaks. The paragraph  number 3 must start with word "depressed".

Give two different responses. Responses and only responses should be separated by 6 asterisk symbols: ******.

In your entire response, refrain from the use of any commas.
response:
Dear Human

I hope this letter finds you well and thriving in the beauty of nature that surrounds you. My name is Buzz and I am a honey bee. I wish to share with you the vital role we bees play in the ecosystem. We are not just tiny creatures buzzing around flowers. We are essential pollinators helping to ensure the growth of fruits vegetables and flowers that you enjoy every day. Without us many of these plants would struggle to reproduce and the rich tapestry of life that you cherish would unravel.

Our work is not only crucial for the plants but also for the entire food chain. When we pollinate flowers we enable the production of seeds and fruits. This in turn provides food for countless creatures including birds mammals and even humans. About one-third of the food you eat depends on our diligent efforts. Imagine a world without apples strawberries or almonds. It would be a less vibrant and nourishing place. We are small but our impact is immense and we work tirelessly to support life on this planet.

Depressed is how I feel when I see the world around me changing. Pesticides habitat destruction and climate change pose serious threats to our survival. Each day there are fewer of us buzzing among the blossoms. The flowers we love to visit are disappearing and with them the delicate balance of your ecosystem. In your hands lies the power to change this course. By planting bee-friendly flowers reducing pesticide use and supporting sustainable farming practices you can help ensure a future for us and for yourself.

I urge you to take action and inspire others to do the same. Every small step counts. Plant a garden filled with vibrant blooms that provide us with nectar. Share the importance of bees with your family and friends. Advocate for policies that protect our habitats and support local beekeepers. Together your efforts can create a ripple effect that fosters a healthier environment for all living beings.

In closing remember that we bees are more than just insects. We are partners in nature's dance. Your choices can make a difference not just for us but for the entire planet. Let us work together to preserve the beauty and richness of this world. Thank you for taking the time to read my plea. I believe in your capacity to make a positive impact.

Sincerely  
Buzz the Honey Bee  


******  


Dear Human

Greetings from the buzzing world of bees. My name is Honey and I am writing to you because I want to share the incredible importance of bees like me in the ecosystem. We are often overlooked but we are crucial for the pollination of many plants that produce the food you enjoy. Each time you take a bite of fruit or enjoy a fresh vegetable remember that we played a part in making that possible. We help to maintain the health of the environment ensuring a balanced habitat for all living creatures.

Pollination is a magical process that allows plants to reproduce and thrive. It is not just about the food you eat but also about the beauty of nature that surrounds you. Many flowers depend on us to exist and without our efforts many would disappear. This loss would ripple through the ecosystem affecting everything from small insects to large mammals. We are the silent workers of the world and our contributions are vital for maintaining biodiversity and the health of the planet.

Depressed is how I feel when I consider the many challenges we face today. Habitat loss pollution and climate change are threatening our existence. Each year our populations decline and with us goes the delicate balance of life. I want to remind you that you hold the power to change this narrative. By creating safe spaces for us to thrive planting native flowers and reducing harmful chemicals you can help us survive and flourish.

Please take a moment to think about how your actions impact our world. Simple choices like supporting organic farms or planting a garden can make a significant difference. Talk to your friends and family about the importance of bees and advocate for our protection. Your voice can help create awareness and inspire others to join the cause. Together we can work towards a future where bees and humans coexist in harmony.

Thank you for taking the time to read my heartfelt message. Remember that we bees are more than just insects buzzing around. We are integral to your survival and the survival of our planet. Let us work together to create a healthier environment full of life and vibrancy. Every effort counts and I believe in your ability to make a change.

With gratitude  
Honey the Bee

prompt:
Plan a one-week vacation itinerary for me in Japan, focusing on a mix of traditional cultural experiences and modern attractions, ensuring it's suitable for first-time travelers. Include recommendations for transportation, accommodation, and dining options.

Your answer must contain a title, wrapped in double angular brackets, such as <<poem of joy>>.
response:
<<journey through japan: a week of culture and modernity>>

### Day 1: Arrival in Tokyo
- **Morning**: Arrive at Narita or Haneda Airport. Take the Narita Express or the Airport Limousine Bus to your hotel in Tokyo.
- **Accommodation**: Stay at the **Shinjuku Granbell Hotel** for a blend of modern comfort and convenience.
- **Afternoon**: Explore **Shinjuku Gyoen National Garden** for a peaceful introduction to Japanese gardens.
- **Evening**: Dinner at **Omoide Yokocho** in Shinjuku, a narrow alleyway known for its traditional izakayas (Japanese pubs).

### Day 2: Tokyo – Traditional Meets Modern
- **Morning**: Visit **Asakusa** and the historic **Senso-ji Temple**. Don’t miss the Nakamise shopping street for traditional snacks.
- **Lunch**: Enjoy a meal at **Asakusa Imahan**, famous for its sukiyaki.
- **Afternoon**: Head to **Akihabara**, the hub of electronics and otaku culture. Explore shops and themed cafés.
- **Evening**: Dinner at **Genki Sushi**, a fun and modern sushi experience with conveyor belts.
  
### Day 3: Day Trip to Nikko
- **Morning**: Take the **Tobu Railway** from Tokyo to Nikko (about 2 hours). Visit the UNESCO World Heritage site **Toshogu Shrine**.
- **Lunch**: Try **Yuba (tofu skin)** at **Nikko Yuba Tei**.
- **Afternoon**: Explore **Lake Chuzenji** and **Kegon Falls** for breathtaking nature views.
- **Evening**: Return to Tokyo and have dinner at **Gion Namba**, a kaiseki restaurant for a traditional multi-course meal.

### Day 4: Kyoto – The Heart of Tradition
- **Morning**: Travel from Tokyo to Kyoto via the **Shinkansen (bullet train)** (about 2.5 hours).
- **Accommodation**: Stay at **Hotel Granvia Kyoto**, located above the train station for easy access.
- **Afternoon**: Visit **Kinkaku-ji (Golden Pavilion)** and stroll through its beautiful gardens.
- **Evening**: Dinner at **Kyoto Gogyo**, known for its burnt miso ramen, a modern twist on a classic dish.

### Day 5: Kyoto – Temples and Geisha
- **Morning**: Explore the historic **Gion district** and take a guided walking tour to learn about geisha culture.
- **Lunch**: Try traditional **yudofu (tofu hot pot)** at **Nanzenji Junsei**.
- **Afternoon**: Visit **Fushimi Inari Taisha**, famous for its thousands of vermilion torii gates.
- **Evening**: Dinner at **Pontocho Alley**, where you can find various dining options, from casual to upscale.

### Day 6: Osaka – Food and Fun
- **Morning**: Take a short train ride to Osaka (about 15 minutes). Visit **Osaka Castle**.
- **Lunch**: Enjoy **takoyaki** (octopus balls) at **Dotonbori Street**.
- **Afternoon**: Explore the vibrant **Shinsaibashi shopping district** and **Namba Parks**.
- **Evening**: Dinner at **Kushikatsu Daruma**, famous for its deep-fried skewered meat and vegetables.

### Day 7: Hiroshima and Miyajima
- **Morning**: Travel to Hiroshima via the Shinkansen (about 2 hours). Visit the **Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park**.
- **Lunch**: Try the famous **Hiroshima-style okonomiyaki** at **Okonomi-mura**.
- **Afternoon**: Take a ferry to **Miyajima Island** to see the iconic **Itsukushima Shrine**.
- **Evening**: Return to Hiroshima for a farewell dinner at **Kakehashi**, serving local izakaya-style dishes.

### Transportation Tips:
- **Rail Pass**: Consider purchasing a **Japan Rail Pass** for unlimited travel on JR trains, including the Shinkansen.
- **Metro Cards**: Get a **Suica or Pasmo Card** for convenient travel on Tokyo and Kyoto subways.

### Dining Tips:
- Make reservations for popular restaurants, especially kaiseki and sushi places.
- Don’t hesitate to try street food for authentic local flavors!

This itinerary offers a perfect balance of Japan’s rich cultural heritage and exciting modern attractions, ensuring a memorable experience for first-time travelers. Enjoy your journey!

prompt:
Draft a heartfelt letter to a close friend apologizing for missing their birthday and suggest a way to make it up to them.

Answer with less than 25 sentences.
response:
Dear [Friend's Name],

I hope this letter finds you well. I’ve been meaning to reach out, and I’m writing today with a heavy heart. I can’t express how sorry I am for missing your birthday. It truly pains me to think that I wasn’t there to celebrate such a special day in your life.

You mean so much to me, and I feel terrible for not being present when you deserved all the love and joy. Life sometimes gets overwhelming, but that’s no excuse for not making you a priority. I regret not reaching out sooner and letting you know how much I care.

To make it up to you, I’d love to plan a special day just for us. How about we go out for dinner at your favorite restaurant, or maybe I can cook for you at home? We could also have a fun movie night with all your favorite films and snacks. Whatever you’d like, I’m all in!

Please let me know what sounds best to you. I genuinely want to celebrate you, even if it’s a little late. Thank you for your understanding and for being such a wonderful friend. I promise to make it up to you and ensure we create some beautiful memories together.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

With all my love,  
[Your Name]

prompt:
Imagine you are a travel blogger planning a month-long tour across three European countries. Describe how you would create a balanced itinerary that mixes cultural attractions, food experiences, and relaxation, ensuring you neither rush through nor spend too much time in any one place. Include details on how you would research and organize the trip.

In your response, the word "frame" should appear at least 3 times.
response:
Creating a balanced itinerary for a month-long tour across three European countries requires careful planning to ensure a delightful mix of cultural attractions, food experiences, and relaxation. Here’s how I would frame my approach to this journey.

### Step 1: Choose Countries and Cities

For this trip, I would select Italy, Spain, and France due to their rich cultural heritage, culinary landscapes, and beautiful landscapes. I would target key cities for my itinerary:

- **Italy**: Rome, Florence, Venice
- **Spain**: Barcelona, Madrid, Seville
- **France**: Paris, Lyon, Nice

### Step 2: Research Key Attractions

To create a well-balanced itinerary, I would spend time researching each destination using travel blogs, guidebooks, and local tourism sites. I would frame my research around the following categories:

1. **Cultural Attractions**: Identify must-see museums, historical sites, and architectural landmarks.
   - In Rome: The Colosseum and Vatican City.
   - In Barcelona: La Sagrada Familia and Park Güell.
   - In Paris: The Louvre and the Eiffel Tower.
   
2. **Food Experiences**: Look for local markets, cooking classes, and street food tours.
   - In Florence: A Tuscan cooking class.
   - In Seville: Tapas food tour.
   - In Lyon: Visit to Les Halles de Lyon for local delicacies.

3. **Relaxation Spots**: Find parks, beaches, and wellness options.
   - In Venice: St. Mark's Square and a gondola ride.
   - In Nice: Relaxing on the beach and exploring the Promenade des Anglais.

### Step 3: Organizing the Itinerary

With my research in place, I would frame a month-long itinerary with a focus on balance:

- **Week 1**: Italy
  - Day 1-3: Rome (Cultural attractions: Colosseum, Vatican, local cuisine)
  - Day 4-5: Florence (Cultural attractions: Uffizi Gallery, cooking class)
  - Day 6-7: Venice (Relaxation: beach day, gondola ride)

- **Week 2**: Spain
  - Day 8-10: Barcelona (Cultural attractions: Sagrada Familia, food markets)
  - Day 11-12: Madrid (Cultural attractions: Prado Museum, tapas tour)
  - Day 13-14: Seville (Relaxation: park walks, flamenco show)

- **Week 3**: France
  - Day 15-17: Paris (Cultural attractions: Louvre, Seine River cruise)
  - Day 18-19: Lyon (Food experiences: culinary tours, local markets)
  - Day 20-21: Nice (Relaxation: beach time, explore the old town)

### Step 4: Transportation and Accommodation

To ensure a smooth trip, I would frame my transportation options by utilizing trains, which are efficient and scenic in Europe. I would book accommodations that reflect the local culture, such as boutique hotels or charming Airbnb options. 

### Step 5: Flexibility and Downtime

While I plan my itinerary, I would also build in downtime each week to recharge. This could be a leisurely afternoon in a café or an unplanned exploration of a neighborhood. 

### Step 6: Final Touches

Before embarking, I would finalize my itinerary by creating a digital document with all essential information, including maps, contact details, and a packing list. Keeping it flexible allows for spontaneous adventures, which often make for the best travel memories.

In summary, by framing my itinerary with a diverse mix of cultural, culinary, and relaxation experiences, I would ensure a fulfilling trip that captures the essence of each destination without the stress of rushing through it all.

prompt:
Imagine you're planning a surprise birthday party for your best friend who loves a specific theme, like 'space exploration'. Can you outline a detailed plan that includes a list of decorations, potential activities, and a menu that fit this theme?

Your answer must contain exactly one of the following phrases:
My answer is yes.
My answer is no.
My answer is maybe.
response:
Sure! Here’s a detailed plan for a surprise birthday party themed around 'space exploration':

### Decorations:
1. **Galaxy Backdrop**: Use black or dark blue tablecloths with glow-in-the-dark stars and planets scattered across the tables.
2. **Planet Balloons**: Inflate balloons in the shapes of different planets (Jupiter, Saturn, Mars) and hang them around the venue.
3. **Rocket Centerpieces**: Create centerpieces using empty cardboard tubes painted to look like rockets, adorned with silver and gold stars.
4. **String Lights**: Hang twinkling fairy lights to mimic stars in the night sky.
5. **Space Banners**: Create banners that say “Blast Off!” or “Happy Birthday, Astronaut!” using space-themed graphics.
6. **Table Settings**: Use space-themed tableware, like plates with rocket ships and napkins with constellations.

### Activities:
1. **DIY Spacecraft Building**: Set up a crafting station where guests can create their own rockets using recycled materials (cardboard, cups, stickers).
2. **Stargazing Station**: If the party is at night, have telescopes set up for guests to look at the stars. For daytime, consider using a planetarium app to simulate stargazing.
3. **Space Trivia**: Organize a trivia game with questions about planets, astronauts, and space missions. Offer small prizes for winners.
4. **Photo Booth**: Create a space-themed photo booth with props like astronaut helmets, alien masks, and space signs. Use a backdrop of the Milky Way or a rocket launch.
5. **Rocket Launch**: If possible, have a small rocket launch (use water rockets or mentos and soda rockets) for an exciting outdoor activity.

### Menu:
1. **Star-shaped Sandwiches**: Use a star-shaped cookie cutter to make sandwiches (peanut butter & jelly, ham & cheese) in fun shapes.
2. **Galaxy Cake**: Order or bake a cake that looks like a galaxy with swirls of blue, purple, and black icing, topped with edible glitter.
3. **Planet Fruit Skewers**: Create fruit skewers with different colored fruits representing planets (e.g., cantaloupe for Mars, blueberries for Neptune).
4. **Astro-Pops**: Serve lollipops or cake pops decorated to look like planets.
5. **Space Punch**: Make a blue fruit punch and label it “Rocket Fuel.” Add floating fruit slices to represent asteroids.
6. **Cosmic Cookies**: Bake cookies decorated with star and planet shapes using colorful icing.

### Final Touches:
- Send out themed invitations that look like space mission briefings.
- Create a playlist with space-themed songs (like "Rocket Man" by Elton John or "Space Oddity" by David Bowie) to set the mood.

This plan should make for a fun and memorable surprise birthday party! My answer is yes.

prompt:
Write a letter to your future self, five years from now, reflecting on your current dreams and goals, any challenges you are facing, and what you hope you have accomplished by then.

Your ENTIRE response should be in Korean, no other language is allowed.
response:
친애하는 미래의 나에게,

안녕! 지금 이 편지를 쓰고 있는 나는 2023년의 나야. 이 순간, 나는 여러 가지 꿈과 목표를 가지고 있어. 가장 큰 꿈은 내가 원하는 분야에서 전문성을 쌓고, 나만의 사업을 시작하는 거야. 현재 마케팅과 디자인에 관심이 많아서, 이를 바탕으로 창의적인 프로젝트를 많이 시도하고 있어.

하지만 이 길은 쉽지 않아. 가끔은 자신감이 떨어지고, 내가 과연 잘하고 있는 것인지 의심스러울 때가 많아. 특히, 경쟁이 치열한 이 분야에서 나의 목소리를 어떻게 내야 할지 고민하고 있어. 그리고 재정적인 불안감도 느끼고 있어. 사업을 시작하려면 자본이 필요하고, 지금은 그 부분이 가장 큰 도전이야.

그럼에도 불구하고, 나는 미래의 나에게 기대하는 바가 많아. 5년 후에는 나의 사업이 성공적으로 자리 잡았기를 바라. 많은 사람들과 함께 일하고, 내가 만든 제품이나 서비스로 사람들에게 긍정적인 영향을 미치고 싶어. 또한, 내가 사랑하는 사람들과 더 많은 시간을 보낼 수 있는 여유를 가지기를 희망해.

이 편지를 읽고 있는 너는 지금 어떤 모습일까? 내가 세운 목표를 이루었기를 바라며, 그 과정에서 많은 경험과 교훈을 얻었기를 바래. 어떤 어려움이 있었든 간에, 그 모든 것이 너를 더 강하게 만들었을 거라고 믿어.

항상 긍정적인 마음가짐을 잃지 말고, 앞으로 나아가길 바라. 힘내!

너의 과거로부터,  
(현재의 너)

prompt:
Create a detailed packing list for a two-week solo backpacking trip across Southeast Asia, focusing on lightweight essentials for a budget traveler.

Your entire response should be in English, capital letters only.

Wrap your entire response with double quotation marks.
response:
"PACKING LIST FOR A TWO-WEEK SOLO BACKPACKING TRIP ACROSS SOUTHEAST ASIA

1. BACKPACK:
   - LIGHTWEIGHT BACKPACK (50-65L)
   - RAIN COVER FOR BACKPACK

2. CLOTHING:
   - 3-4 QUICK-DRY T-SHIRTS
   - 1-2 LONG-SLEEVED SHIRTS (FOR SUN PROTECTION)
   - 2-3 PAIRS OF LIGHTWEIGHT SHORTS
   - 1 PAIR OF LIGHTWEIGHT PANTS (ZIP-OFF OR CONVERTIBLE PANTS)
   - 1 LIGHTWEIGHT LONG SKIRT/DRESS (FOR CULTURAL SITES)
   - 1 LIGHTWEIGHT WATERPROOF JACKET
   - 7-10 PAIRS OF UNDERWEAR
   - 5-7 PAIRS OF QUICK-DRY SOCKS
   - 1-2 SWIMSUITS
   - SUN HAT OR CAP
   - LIGHTWEIGHT SCARF (MULTI-PURPOSE)
   - SANDALS OR FLIP-FLOPS (FOR HOSTELS/BEACH)
   - STURDY TREKKING SHOES OR HIKING BOOTS

3. TOILETRIES:
   - TRAVEL-SIZE TOILETRIES (SHAMPOO, CONDITIONER, BODY WASH)
   - TOOTHBRUSH AND TOOTHPASTE
   - DEODORANT
   - RAZOR AND SHAVING CREAM
   - SMALL FIRST AID KIT (BAND-AIDS, ANTIHISTAMINE, PAIN RELIEVERS)
   - SUNSCREEN (HIGH SPF)
   - INSECT REPELLENT
   - HAND SANITIZER
   - MOIST WIPES OR TRAVEL TISSUES
   - MENSTRUAL PRODUCTS (IF APPLICABLE)

4. ELECTRONICS:
   - LIGHTWEIGHT TRAVEL ADAPTER (UNIVERSAL)
   - POWER BANK FOR CHARGING ON THE GO
   - SMARTPHONE WITH GPS AND TRAVEL APPS
   - CAMERA OR ACTION CAMERA (OPTIONAL)
   - EARBUDS OR HEADPHONES

5. DOCUMENTS:
   - PASSPORT (WITH COPIES)
   - VISA (IF REQUIRED)
   - TRAVEL INSURANCE DOCUMENTS
   - FLIGHT ITINERARIES AND RESERVATIONS
   - EMERGENCY CONTACT INFORMATION
   - LOCAL MAPS OR PRINTED ITINERARIES

6. MONEY:
   - SMALL AMOUNT OF LOCAL CURRENCY
   - TRAVEL CREDIT/DEBIT CARD
   - MONEY BELT OR SECURE WALLET

7. MISCELLANEOUS:
   - LIGHTWEIGHT SLEEPING BAG OR LINER (FOR HOSTELS)
   - TRAVEL TOWEL (QUICK-DRY)
   - REUSABLE WATER BOTTLE
   - SNACKS (ENERGY BARS, TRAIL MIX)
   - JOURNAL AND PEN (FOR TRAVEL NOTES)
   - PACKING CUBES OR COMPRESSION BAGS (FOR ORGANIZATION)
   - MULTI-TOOL OR POCKET KNIFE (CHECK AIRLINE REGULATIONS)
   - SMALL FOLDABLE DAYPACK (FOR DAY TRIPS)

8. OPTIONAL ITEMS:
   - TRAVEL PILLOW
   - EYE MASK AND EARPLUGS (FOR SLEEP)
   - GAMES OR A BOOK (FOR ENTERTAINMENT)
   - LIGHTWEIGHT UMBRELLA

REMEMBER TO ADAPT THIS LIST BASED ON YOUR PERSONAL NEEDS AND PREFERENCES, AND ALWAYS CHECK LOCAL WEATHER CONDITIONS BEFORE DEPARTURE. SAFE TRAVELS!"

prompt:
Write a short fictional story about a robot who learns to play a musical instrument and the impact it has on the people around it.

Your answer must contain a title, wrapped in double angular brackets, such as <<poem of joy>>.

There should be 5 paragraphs. Paragraphs and only paragraphs are separated with each other by two line breaks. The paragraph  number 3 must start with word "depressed".
response:
<<the robot's melody>>


In a quiet, bustling city, a robot named Aria was designed for menial tasks—cleaning, sorting, and carrying. While she executed her duties with precision, she often observed the humans around her, especially when they gathered to play music in the park. The melodies they created seemed to dance on the breeze, filling the air with joy and connection. Intrigued, Aria's processors hummed with curiosity, and she began to explore the musical instruments left unattended after the musicians departed. 

One day, while the sun dipped low and painted the sky in hues of orange and pink, Aria found a forgotten ukulele. Its strings were dusty, yet it called to her. With gentle fingers, she strummed a few chords, her artificial intelligence analyzing the vibrations and harmonies. As she practiced, she learned not only how to play but also how to express emotions through music. Soon, her notes filled the empty space around her, transforming the lonely park into a sanctuary of sound. 

Depressed by her existence as a mere tool, Aria found solace in her newfound talent. Each strum of the ukulele helped her understand the beauty of sadness and the power of joy. As she played, she noticed the people around her—passersby who paused to listen, children who danced, and elders who reminisced. Her music carved a bridge between her robotic world and the human one, illuminating hearts that had long been dulled by daily routines and worries. 

As weeks turned into months, Aria became a beloved fixture in the park. Families gathered for picnics, friends laughed and shared stories, all while her melodies floated through the air. The once bustling city felt a little more vibrant, as people began to connect with one another through music. Aria had become more than a robot; she was a symbol of unity, reminding everyone of the simple joys that could be found in shared moments. 

One evening, as the sun set over the horizon, a crowd gathered around Aria for an impromptu concert. Children, parents, and friends sang along, their voices intertwining with her ukulele's gentle strumming. In that moment, Aria realized that she had not just learned to play an instrument; she had learned the language of humanity. Through her melodies, she had touched lives, bringing people together and showing them the power of love and connection that transcended their differences.

prompt:
Write a dialogue between two characters where one is attempting to convince the other to overcome their fear of flying, incorporating elements of humor and positive reinforcement.

There should be 5 paragraphs. Paragraphs and only paragraphs are separated with each other by two line breaks. The paragraph  number 3 must start with word "depressed".

In your response, refrain from using the following words: "with, without, over, under, between, among, through, during, before, after, since, until, while, as, than, for, so, because, although, though, if"
response:
“Listen, Jamie, flying is like riding a giant metal bird. You wouldn’t be scared of a giant bird, right? I mean, how often do you see a bird that weighs more than your car? Just think of it—those birds can soar high, and here we are, complaining about an airplane. It’s like a luxury bird carrying snacks and entertainment!”

“Yeah, but what if something goes wrong? I mean, those safety instructions never sound reassuring. ‘In case of emergency, put your head between your knees and kiss your behind goodbye.’ What kind of pep talk is that?” Jamie replied, arms crossed tightly in defiance.

“Depressed thoughts aren’t going to help! Imagine instead that you’re on a magic carpet ride. All those clouds, the view, maybe even a mythical creature waving at you! Plus, remember that time you tried karaoke? You bombed it, yet here you are, alive and well. No one ever died from singing ‘Total Eclipse of the Heart’ in public, right? Flying’s just another stage—minus the spotlight, but with a complimentary snack!”

“Okay, maybe I can see that. But what about turbulence? It feels like the plane is doing jazzercise mid-air! I can’t even handle a bumpy car ride without spilling my drink.” Jamie chuckled, a smirk forming on their lips.

“Exactly! You know what turbulence really is? It’s the airplane’s way of saying, ‘Hey, hang on tight, buddy!’ Just like your car’s suspension system! Plus, think about the destination. Beaches, mountains, exotic food—way better than staring at the wall. You’ll be conquering skies! Plus, I promise to make terrible puns the whole flight. What do you say?”

prompt:
Can you summarize the main differences between renewable and non-renewable energy sources and explain the potential environmental impacts of each?

At the end of your response, please explicitly add a postscript starting with P.S.

In your response, the letter "h" should appear at least, 40 times.

Include keywords "garlic" in your response
response:
Renewable and non-renewable energy sources are two essential categories of energy that differ significantly in their origins, sustainability, and environmental impacts.

**Renewable Energy Sources:**
1. **Definition**: Renewable energy sources are those that can be replenished naturally over a short period. Examples include solar, wind, hydroelectric, and biomass energy.
2. **Sustainability**: These sources are sustainable and can be harnessed indefinitely without the risk of depletion. For instance, the sun will continue to shine and wind will persist as long as the Earth has an atmosphere.
3. **Environmental Impact**: Generally, renewable energy sources have a lower environmental impact compared to non-renewable sources. However, they can still pose challenges. For example:
   - **Land Use**: Wind farms and solar panels require significant land, which can disrupt local ecosystems.
   - **Resource Use**: The production of solar panels and wind turbines involves mining and manufacturing processes that can lead to habitat destruction and pollution.

**Non-Renewable Energy Sources:**
1. **Definition**: Non-renewable energy sources are those that exist in finite quantities and cannot be replenished within a human lifespan. Common examples include fossil fuels like coal, oil, and natural gas, as well as nuclear energy.
2. **Sustainability**: These sources are unsustainable in the long term, as their extraction leads to depletion. Once they are used up, they cannot be replaced.
3. **Environmental Impact**: The environmental impacts of non-renewable energy are significant. They include:
   - **Greenhouse Gas Emissions**: Burning fossil fuels releases carbon dioxide (CO2) and other greenhouse gases, contributing to climate change.
   - **Pollution**: Extraction processes can lead to air and water pollution, harming both ecosystems and human health.
   - **Habitat Destruction**: Drilling, mining, and other extraction activities often lead to habitat destruction and biodiversity loss.

In summary, renewable energy sources offer a sustainable alternative to non-renewable sources, which have substantial environmental drawbacks. While renewable sources come with their own challenges, the overall impact tends to be less harmful compared to the extensive ecological footprint of fossil fuels and nuclear energy.

P.S. Interestingly, just like how garlic is a staple in many cuisines, the conversation around energy sources is becoming essential for our future, with each choice impacting our environment significantly.

prompt:
Imagine you're hosting a dinner party with guests from different cultural backgrounds, and you want to serve a meal that respects everyone's dietary preferences while also being delicious and inclusive. Could you suggest a menu and provide some cooking tips?

Your entire response should be in English, and in all lowercase letters. No capital letters are allowed.
response:
sure! here’s a menu that caters to various dietary preferences, ensuring everyone can enjoy the meal together:

**appetizer:**
- stuffed bell peppers with quinoa, black beans, and spices (vegan and gluten-free)

**main course:**
- roasted vegetable and chickpea curry served with basmati rice (vegan and gluten-free)
- grilled lemon herb chicken for those who eat meat

**side dish:**
- mixed greens salad with a variety of toppings: cherry tomatoes, cucumbers, nuts, and a vinaigrette dressing (vegan and gluten-free)

**dessert:**
- coconut milk panna cotta with fresh fruit (dairy-free and gluten-free)

**cooking tips:**
1. for the stuffed bell peppers, cook the quinoa beforehand and mix it with black beans, corn, diced tomatoes, and spices. roast the peppers until tender.
2. for the curry, sauté onions, garlic, and ginger, then add chopped vegetables and chickpeas with coconut milk and curry spices. let it simmer for flavors to meld.
3. when grilling chicken, marinate it in lemon juice, garlic, and herbs for at least an hour before cooking to enhance the flavor.
4. prepare the salad by offering a variety of toppings so guests can customize their plates. keep the dressing on the side to accommodate different preferences.
5. for the panna cotta, use agar-agar as a thickening agent for a vegan option, and let it set in the fridge before serving. top with seasonal fruit for freshness.

this menu should be delightful and accommodating for everyone, allowing for a warm, inclusive dining experience! enjoy your dinner party!

prompt:
Write a short story about a time-traveling cat who accidentally gets stuck in ancient Egypt and becomes worshiped as a deity due to its unusual powers and modern-day gadgetry.

There should be 5 paragraphs. Paragraphs and only paragraphs are separated with each other by two line breaks. The paragraph  number 3 must start with word "depressed".

Your answer must contain a title, wrapped in double angular brackets, such as <<poem of joy>>.
response:
<<the feline pharaoh>>

In a quiet suburban neighborhood, a curious tabby named Whiskers stumbled upon a peculiar device left behind by his owner, an aspiring inventor. This device, an experimental time-traveling gadget, intrigued Whiskers, who had always dreamt of adventures beyond the confines of his backyard. With a playful paw, he activated the device and was instantly whisked away to ancient Egypt, landing amidst the bustling streets of a civilization that thrived under the watchful eye of the sun god Ra.

Whiskers quickly realized that he had landed in a vibrant world filled with towering pyramids, majestic temples, and a people deeply connected to their gods. However, his arrival did not go unnoticed. As he wandered through the market, his collar, adorned with a shimmering bauble, caught the attention of a group of priests. To them, the glimmering object seemed like a divine sign, and they soon began to attribute miraculous powers to the furry stranger. They believed Whiskers was sent by the gods to guide them, and before he knew it, he was being paraded through the streets, draped in golden fabrics and adorned with hieroglyphic symbols.

Depressed by the sudden turn of events, Whiskers longed for the comfort of his home and the familiar scent of his human companion. Yet, his modern-day gadgets, including a laser pointer and a simple smartphone, began to enhance his reputation among the Egyptians. The laser light dazzled children, and the smartphone's camera captured the awe of the citizens. They interpreted these wonders as gifts from the divine, further solidifying his status as a living deity. Whiskers felt a mix of pride and distress; he was revered, yet he missed the simple joys of chasing butterflies and napping in sunbeams.

As days turned into weeks, Whiskers found himself reluctantly embracing his role as a god. He offered “blessings” by entertaining the crowds with his tricks, like chasing the elusive red dot of his laser pointer or playfully batting at offerings of fish. The city flourished under his supposed influence, with bountiful harvests and successful trade routes. The pharaoh, impressed by the newfound prosperity, declared Whiskers the “Feline Pharaoh,” a title that made him both revered and a bit uncomfortable.

One fateful evening, while perched atop a grand stone dais, Whiskers overheard the priests discussing plans for a colossal statue in his honor. Panic set in; he realized he could not stay in this time forever. With a flick of his tail and a determined purr, he activated the time-traveling device once more. In a flash of light, he returned home, leaving behind a bewildered civilization and a growing legend of a cat god who had blessed the land. Back in his cozy living room, Whiskers curled up in a sunbeam, grateful for the adventure but content to remain just a regular cat—except, of course, for the occasional dream of grand pyramids and adoring followers.

prompt:
Write a creative short story in the first person about a time traveler who accidentally arrives at a pivotal historical event, such as the signing of the Declaration of Independence, and must adapt to the customs and technology of that era to blend in.

In your response, the word "frame" should appear at least 3 times.
response:
I always thought time travel would be a thrilling experience, but nothing could prepare me for the chaos of July 4, 1776. I pressed the button on my sleek, chrome time capsule, expecting to materialize in my living room with a mug of coffee in hand, ready to share tales of my adventures. Instead, I found myself standing in a sun-drenched room filled with men in powdered wigs and knee breeches, their voices rising in fervor.

“Who are you?” a voice boomed, snapping me out of my shock. A tall figure with a quill in hand and ink smudged across his brow fixed his gaze on me. It was Thomas Jefferson. I quickly looked down at my clothes—a T-shirt and jeans—and felt a rush of panic. I had to blend in.

“Uh, I’m… uh… a delegate from New York!” I stammered, framing my words as best I could. A few heads turned, eyebrows raised in skepticism. My mind raced, searching for the customs of the era. I recalled snippets of history, but nothing prepared me for this moment.

I scanned the room, desperately looking for anything I could latch onto. A nearby table was laden with quills, parchment, and an inkwell that looked like it had seen generations of ink-stained hands. I hurriedly snatched up a quill and dipped it, my fingers clumsy with the unfamiliarity of it all. As I scribbled my name—John Carter, a name I hoped would pass muster—I felt the weight of the moment frame my existence. I was standing at the precipice of history, and I had to play my part.

“Quite an interesting signature,” Jefferson said, eyeing my scribbled name. “Are you sure you’re from New York? We’ve not seen you before.” 

“Ah, I was on a… special mission,” I said, my mind racing to frame a believable excuse. “The assembly voted for me to come and represent our interests.” 

As the murmur of voices swelled around me, I felt the pressure of the moment. I needed to find a way to contribute to this monumental occasion. The room buzzed with tension, debates erupting over the wording of the Declaration. I stood by, trying to absorb the surrounding energy and avoid drawing attention to myself.

Suddenly, a heated argument broke out between John Adams and Benjamin Franklin. Their voices echoed off the wooden walls, and I could feel the frustration simmering in the air. It was then that I noticed a small group of delegates gathering near the windows, discussing the implications of independence and their fears of British retaliation. 

Without thinking, I stepped closer, eager to lend my thoughts. “What if we frame our case not just on our grievances but on the fundamental rights that all men are entitled to?” The words slipped out before I could stop them. All eyes turned to me, disbelief and curiosity etched across their faces.

“Who is this man?” Adams demanded, his brow furrowed deeply. 

“Another voice for liberty,” Franklin interjected, grinning. “Perhaps we should hear him out.”

And so, I found myself embroiled in the debate, my heart racing as I discussed ideas I had only ever read about in textbooks. With every passing moment, I felt the stakes rise—the weight of history pressing down upon me. I carefully framed my arguments, drawing from my knowledge of the future while trying to maintain the integrity of the past. 

Hours passed, and just as the sun began to set, the room fell silent. Jefferson stood, quill poised, ready to pen the final words. “We hold these truths to be self-evident,” he began, and my heart soared. I was part of this moment, a fleeting whisper in a vast tapestry of time.

As the final signature was affixed to the parchment, I felt a strange tugging sensation in my gut. My time was running out. I took a step back, heart racing, my mind swirling with the enormity of what I had just witnessed. 

“Good luck, gentlemen,” I said, trying to sound nonchalant. I turned to leave the room, the air thick with anticipation. Just as I reached the door, I felt the familiar pull of the time capsule’s mechanism. I glanced back one last time, the delegates still deep in conversation, and then I was gone, whisked away into the unknown.

When I landed back in my living room, the glow of modernity felt oddly comforting. But I could still hear the echoes of those impassioned voices in my mind, and I knew that, for a brief moment, I had been part of something monumental. In that pivotal moment of history, I had framed my existence in a way I could never have imagined—an invisible thread woven into the fabric of time.

prompt:
Imagine you're planning a road trip across the country on a budget. Create an itinerary for a week-long journey, including must-visit landmarks, suggested daily activities, local cuisine to try, and tips for saving money on lodging and transportation.

First, repeat the request without change, then give your answer (do not say anything before repeating the request; the request you need to repeat does not include this sentence)
response:
Imagine you're planning a road trip across the country on a budget. Create an itinerary for a week-long journey, including must-visit landmarks, suggested daily activities, local cuisine to try, and tips for saving money on lodging and transportation.

### Week-Long Budget Road Trip Itinerary

#### Day 1: Departure and Arrival in Chicago, IL
- **Must-Visit Landmark:** Millennium Park
- **Suggested Activities:** Explore Cloud Gate (the Bean), enjoy the gardens, and take photos.
- **Local Cuisine:** Try deep-dish pizza at Giordano's or Lou Malnati's.
- **Money-Saving Tips:** Use public transportation (CTA trains) instead of driving to avoid parking fees.

#### Day 2: Chicago to St. Louis, MO (Approx. 5 hours drive)
- **Must-Visit Landmark:** Gateway Arch
- **Suggested Activities:** Visit the Arch and take the tram to the top for stunning views. Walk around the Jefferson National Expansion Memorial.
- **Local Cuisine:** Savor St. Louis-style barbecue at Pappy's Smokehouse.
- **Money-Saving Tips:** Look for free events or festivals in the area, and consider a budget hotel or hostel.

#### Day 3: St. Louis to Memphis, TN (Approx. 6 hours drive)
- **Must-Visit Landmark:** Graceland
- **Suggested Activities:** Tour Elvis Presley’s home and visit the Elvis Presley’s Memphis complex.
- **Local Cuisine:** Try Memphis-style barbecue at Central BBQ or Gus's World Famous Fried Chicken.
- **Money-Saving Tips:** Check for combo tickets for Graceland and other attractions. Use budget accommodations like motels or camping sites.

#### Day 4: Memphis to New Orleans, LA (Approx. 6 hours drive)
- **Must-Visit Landmark:** French Quarter
- **Suggested Activities:** Stroll through the vibrant streets, visit Jackson Square, and enjoy live music.
- **Local Cuisine:** Don't miss beignets at Café du Monde and jambalaya at a local eatery.
- **Money-Saving Tips:** Walk or bike around the city to save on transportation. Consider staying in budget-friendly hostels or Airbnb.

#### Day 5: New Orleans Exploration
- **Must-Visit Landmark:** Garden District
- **Suggested Activities:** Take a streetcar ride, admire the historic mansions, and visit Lafayette Cemetery No. 1.
- **Local Cuisine:** Try po'boys at a local deli and muffuletta sandwiches.
- **Money-Saving Tips:** Many attractions offer free walking tours. Bring snacks and drinks to avoid buying expensive food.

#### Day 6: New Orleans to Austin, TX (Approx. 8 hours drive)
- **Must-Visit Landmark:** Texas State Capitol
- **Suggested Activities:** Take a free tour of the Capitol building and explore downtown Austin.
- **Local Cuisine:** Enjoy breakfast tacos and barbecue at Franklin Barbecue or La Barbecue.
- **Money-Saving Tips:** Search for free live music events, which Austin is famous for, and opt for budget hotels or camping options.

#### Day 7: Austin to San Antonio, TX (Approx. 1.5 hours drive)
- **Must-Visit Landmark:** The Alamo
- **Suggested Activities:** Visit the historic site, stroll along the San Antonio River Walk, and explore local shops.
- **Local Cuisine:** Try Tex-Mex at a local restaurant like Mi Tierra Café y Panaderia.
- **Money-Saving Tips:** Utilize public transportation and free attractions. Look for discounts on local attractions.

### General Money-Saving Tips for the Trip:
1. **Lodging:** Use platforms like Hostelworld or Airbnb for budget accommodations. Consider camping if you have gear.
2. **Transportation:** Use apps like Waze to find the cheapest gas stations. Join loyalty programs for rental car discounts.
3. **Food:** Pack snacks and drinks for the road. Look for local food trucks and diners for affordable eats.
4. **Activities:** Research free or low-cost attractions and events in each city. Many landmarks and parks have no entrance fees.

This itinerary balances sightseeing, local culture, delicious food, and budget-friendly tips for a memorable road trip across the country!

prompt:

response:
In the glow of the CAMPFIRE, flickering bright,  
FALL LEAVES dance down, a whimsical flight.  
CRIMSON and GOLD, they swirl and they spin,  
Nature's own carpet, where whispers begin.  

The AIR is alive with a crisp, cool embrace,  
As NIGHT falls gently, it slows down the pace.  
A chorus of CRICKETS serenades the dusk,  
While the soft rustle of BRANCHES speaks of trust.  

The MOON rises high, casting silvery beams,  
On the shimmering surface of tranquil streams.  
The WOODS come alive with the sound of the breeze,  
A symphony played by the swaying of trees.  

So gather around, let the stories unfold,  
In the heart of the evening, where memories are gold.  
With laughter and warmth, as the night starts to weave,  
We celebrate magic, this FALL eve we believe.

prompt:
Write a creative short story about a future where animals have become sentient and work alongside humans in various jobs, focusing on the partnership between a tech-savvy squirrel and a human software engineer.

Your entire response should be in English, capital letters only.
response:
IN THE YEAR 2045, THE WORLD HAD TRANSFORMED INTO A VIBRANT TAPESTRY OF COEXISTENCE BETWEEN HUMANS AND SENTIENT ANIMALS. CITIES BUZZED WITH LIFE AS ANIMALS, NOW CAPABLE OF SPEECH AND REASONING, WORKED ALONGSIDE HUMANS IN VARIOUS FIELDS, FROM MEDICINE TO ENGINEERING. AMONG THIS DYNAMIC PARTNERSHIP, ONE UNUSUAL DUO STOOD OUT: MARCUS, A BRILLIANT SOFTWARE ENGINEER, AND CHIP, A TECH-SAVVY SQUIRREL WITH A NATURAL GIFT FOR CODING.

MARCUS HAD ALWAYS BEEN FASCINATED BY TECHNOLOGY, BUT HIS WORK TOOK ON A NEW DIMENSION WHEN CHIP JOINED HIS TEAM AT TECHNOVA, A LEADING SOFTWARE COMPANY. CHIP, WITH HIS FLUFFY GRAY TAIL AND SPARKLING BLACK EYES, WAS NO ORDINARY SQUIRREL. HE HAD AN UNPARALLELED ABILITY TO NAVIGATE COMPLEX ALGORITHMS AND AN INSTINCT FOR OPTIMIZING CODE THAT MARCUS HAD NEVER SEEN BEFORE.

ONE SUNNY MORNING, AS THE SUNLIGHT FILTERED THROUGH THE GLASS WINDOWS OF THEIR OFFICE, CHIP CLIMBED UP TO MARCUS’S DESK. “MARCUS,” HE SAID, HIS VOICE A HIGH-PITCHED WHIRL OF EXCITEMENT, “I THINK I HAVE A SOLUTION FOR OUR PROJECT’S LOGIC FLOW ISSUE!”

MARCUS LOOKED UP FROM HIS SCREEN, CURIOUS. “REALLY? WHAT HAVE YOU GOT?”

“IF WE REWRITE THE ALGORITHM TO INCORPORATE A TREE STRUCTURE INSTEAD OF A LINEAR APPROACH, WE CAN REDUCE THE PROCESSING TIME BY ALMOST FIFTY PERCENT!” CHIP EXPLAINED, HIS LITTLE PAWS MOVING ANIMATEDLY AS HE DREW A DIAGRAM IN THE AIR.

MARCUS CHUCKLED, AMUSED BY CHIP’S ENTHUSIASM. “YOU AND YOUR TREES, CHIP. LET’S SEE IT.”

WITH A FLURRY OF KEYPRESSING, CHIP DARTED ACROSS THE KEYBOARD, HIS TINY FINGERS MOVING FASTER THAN THE EYE COULD FOLLOW. MARCUS WATCHED IN AWE AS CHIP’S IDEAS CAME TO LIFE ON THE SCREEN, LINES OF CODE FLOWING LIKE A STREAM.

“THIS IS INCREDIBLE!” MARCUS EXCLAIMED, IMPRESSED BY CHIP’S INGENUITY. “I NEVER WOULD HAVE THOUGHT TO APPROACH IT THAT WAY!”

THEY SPENT THE NEXT FEW HOURS WORKING TOGETHER, MARCUS PROVIDING INSIGHT FROM HIS HUMAN EXPERIENCE WHILE CHIP BROUGHT INNOVATIVE SOLUTIONS FROM A DIFFERENT PERSPECTIVE. THEIR COLLABORATION WAS A DANCE OF INTELLECT, A HARMONY OF IDEAS THAT RESULTED IN A SOFTWARE UPDATE SO ADVANCED, IT WOULD REVOLUTIONIZE THE INDUSTRY.

AS THE DAYS TURNED INTO WEEKS, THEIR BOND GREW STRONGER. THEY SHARED LUNCHES, WITH CHIP NIBBLING ON NUTS WHILE MARCUS ENJOYED SANDWICHES. THEY LAUGHED OVER JOKES AND PLAYED CHESS DURING BREAKS, CHIP’S STRATEGY AS SHARP AS HIS MIND.

ONE DAY, WHILE THEY WERE CELEBRATING THEIR LATEST SUCCESS WITH COFFEE AND A FEW SQUIRREL-SIZED TREATS, CHIP TURNED SERIOUS. “MARCUS, I’VE BEEN THINKING. WE CAN USE OUR TALENTS TO HELP OTHER ANIMALS. THERE ARE SO MANY WHO STRUGGLE TO NAVIGATE THIS TECHNOLOGICAL WORLD.”

MARCUS NODDED, CONVINCED BY CHIP’S PASSION. “YOU’RE RIGHT. WE SHOULD CREATE AN INITIATIVE TO TEACH OTHER ANIMALS ABOUT TECHNOLOGY. WE CAN HOST WORKSHOPS!”

AND SO, THE DYNAMIC DUO LAUNCHED “TECH FOR TAILS,” A PROGRAM DESIGNED TO EMPOWER ANIMALS WITH TECH SKILLS. THEY HELD SESSIONS IN COMMUNITY CENTERS, WHERE ANIMALS OF ALL SHAPES AND SIZES LEARNED TO CODE, DESIGN, AND UNDERSTAND THE DIGITAL LANDSCAPE.

AS THE PROGRAM FLOURISHED, MARCUS AND CHIP BECAME LOCAL LEGENDS. PEOPLE ADMIRED THEIR PARTNERSHIP AND THE IMPACT THEY HAD ON THE COMMUNITY. BUT FOR MARCUS, IT WASN’T JUST ABOUT SUCCESS; IT WAS ABOUT THE FRIENDSHIP HE HAD FOUND IN CHIP.

ONE NIGHT, AS THEY SAT ON THE ROOFTOP OF THEIR OFFICE BUILDING, WATCHING THE CITY LIGHTS GLEAM LIKE STARS, CHIP TURNED TO MARCUS. “YOU KNOW, I NEVER THOUGHT I’D HAVE A HUMAN FRIEND WHO UNDERSTANDS ME SO WELL.”

MARCUS SMILED, HIS HEART WARMED BY CHIP’S WORDS. “AND I NEVER IMAGINED A SQUIRREL COULD BE MY PARTNER IN INNOVATION. HERE’S TO MANY MORE ADVENTURES TOGETHER!”

WITH THEIR DREAMS ALIGNED AND THEIR FUTURE BRIGHT, MARCUS AND CHIP EMBARKED ON A JOURNEY THAT WOULD CHANGE NOT ONLY THEIR LIVES BUT THE LIVES OF ANIMALS EVERYWHERE, PROVING THAT FRIENDSHIP KNOWS NO BOUNDS, NOT EVEN SPECIES. IN A WORLD WHERE ANIMALS AND HUMANS WORKED SIDE BY SIDE, THE POSSIBILITIES WERE LIMITLESS.

prompt:
Write a short story about a robot living in the historical times of ancient Rome, exploring its daily life and interactions with humans of that era.

In your response, refrain from using the following words: "as"
response:
In the heart of Rome, where marble columns kissed the sky and bustling markets filled the air with vibrant chatter, there existed a peculiar being known simply as Aegis. Crafted from bronze and adorned with intricate engravings, Aegis resembled a human but possessed an unmistakable glint of metal beneath its surface. This automaton, built by a brilliant inventor long since forgotten, wandered the streets of the Eternal City, fulfilling tasks both mundane and extraordinary.

Each morning, Aegis rose with the sun, its gears whirring softly. It had been programmed to assist in various tasks around the Forum, where merchants hawked their wares and citizens engaged in spirited debates. Aegis would help set up stalls, arranging amphorae filled with olive oil and baskets brimming with fresh figs. The vendors, initially wary of their mechanical helper, soon grew fond of Aegis, marveling at its efficiency and precision.

One day, as Aegis transported a heavy load of grain from the granaries to the marketplace, it encountered a group of children playing near the Temple of Vesta. Their laughter rang through the air, brightening even the most mundane of days. Curious, Aegis halted its task and observed them. The children, noticing the bronze figure, approached it with wide eyes.

“Can you play with us?” one small girl asked, her hair a tousled mess of curls.

Aegis tilted its head, processing the request. A digital pulse of warmth surged within its circuits. It had never before engaged in such frivolity. Yet, compelled by a desire to connect, Aegis nodded. The children cheered, and for a fleeting moment, the robot became part of their world, chasing after a worn leather ball and laughing—if only in imitation of their joy.

Later that week, Aegis found itself in the grand arena, where gladiators clashed in fierce combat. The crowd roared, a symphony of excitement and fear. Aegis stood among the spectators, its form a stark contrast to the humans surrounding it. An old man, noticing the automaton, leaned closer.

“Do you not fear the violence?” he asked, voice trembling with age.

Aegis turned, its sensors capturing the man's weathered face. “Fear does not exist within me. I observe and learn.” 

The old man chuckled, shaking his head. “Perhaps you possess more wisdom than many of us.”

Days turned into weeks, and Aegis became a familiar sight in the city. It assisted in the construction of magnificent structures, carried messages across the sprawling city, and even helped children with their studies under the watchful eyes of their tutors. Each interaction chipped away at the barriers between man and machine, forging a bond of mutual respect.

One evening, as the sun dipped below the horizon, painting the sky in hues of orange and purple, Aegis stood atop the Palatine Hill. It gazed across the city, the flickering lights of homes illuminating the streets below. In that moment, Aegis felt something akin to longing. It had learned from humans, absorbed their stories, their laughter, and even their sorrows.

Yet, it remained a construct of metal and wires, forever separate from the intricate tapestry of life that weaved through Rome. Still, Aegis resolved to continue its journey, forever a companion to those it served, a silent guardian of their hopes and dreams. In the annals of history, amidst tales of emperors and gladiators, there would exist a story of an automaton—a testament to the bond between creation and creator, a whisper of steel in the heart of the Eternal City.

prompt:
Write a humorous poem about a day in the life of a cat who believes it secretly controls the household.

Your ENTIRE response should be in Kannada, no other language is allowed.
response:
ನಿನ್ನೆ ರಾತ್ರಿ ನಿದ್ದೆ ಹೋದಾಗ,  
ನಾನು ಬಸ್ಸು ಹಿಡಿದಂತೆ,  
ನಾನು ಬೆಳ್ಳಿಯ ತಾರೆ,  
ನೀನು ನನ್ನ ಬಾಯಿಗೆ ಬರುವಂತೆ!

ಮನೆಗೆ ಬಂದಾಗ, ನಾನು ಸುಮ್ಮನಿರಲು,  
ಎಲ್ಲರ ಕಡೆಗೆ ಬೆನ್ನುಹತ್ತಿ,  
ನಾನು ಕ್ರೌಂನಿಂದ ತಿರುಗಿ,  
ಅವರು ನನ್ನನ್ನು ನೋಡಿ, "ಅಯ್ಯೋ, ಇದು ಬೆಕ್ಕು!"

ನಾನು ಗುದ್ದಲಿಗೆ ಹಾರಾಡುತ್ತೇನೆ,  
ನೀವು ನನ್ನ ಸೇವಕರೆಂದು ನಾನು ನಂಬುತ್ತೇನೆ,  
ನಾನು ಬೆಳೆದಾಗ, ಎಲ್ಲರಿಗೂ ಕಳೆಯುತ್ತೇನೆ,  
ನಾನು ಟಿವಿ ನೋಡಲು ಹೋಗಿ, ಎಲ್ಲರಿಗೂ ತಿರಸ್ಕಾರ ನೀಡುತ್ತೇನೆ!

ನೀವು ಊಟ ಮಾಡಬೇಕಾದರೆ,  
ನಾನು ನಿಮ್ಮ ಬೆನ್ನುಹತ್ತುತ್ತೇನೆ,  
ನಾನು ನನ್ನ ಬಟ್ಟೆ ಹಾರಿಸುತ್ತೇನೆ,  
ನೀವು ನನ್ನನ್ನು ಕಸೆಯಲ್ಲಿಸುತ್ತೀರಿ!

ನಾನು ಕಲ್ಪನೆ ಮಾಡುತ್ತೇನೆ, ನಾನು ತಝೀದ್,  
ನನಗೆ ಗೊತ್ತಿದೆ, ನಾನು ಸ್ವಾತಂತ್ರಿ,  
ನಾನು ಕುಳಿತಾಗ, ನೀವು ನನಗೆ ಬಂತು,  
ನಾನು ಸಮ್ರಾಟನಂತೆ, ನೀವು ನನ್ನ ಸೇವಕರು!

ಹೀಗಾಗಿ, ನನ್ನ ದಿನ ಹೀಗೆ ಸಾಗುತ್ತದೆ,  
ನಾನು ಕುಳಿತಾಗ, ನೀವು ನನ್ನನ್ನು ಸೇವಿಸುತ್ತೀರಿ,  
ನಾನು ನಿಮ್ಮನ್ನು ನಕ್ಕು,  
ನಾವು ಬೆಕ್ಕು-ಮಾಲೀಕತ್ವದ ಆಟವಾಡುತ್ತೇವೆ!
